competencies.name: Driver conducts daily checks listed in Defect Book in a well-lit area away from main traffic routes
Driver checks First Aid box including eye wash to ensure it is complete
Driver checks the external cleanliness of the vehicle including lights, number plates , indicators and windows
Driver checks that the cab is clean and free from unauthorised items
Any defects identified and reported to appropriate personnel
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the procedure for reporting defects to appropriate personnel?

competencies.name: Driver wears high-visibility clothing provided by the company together with any other relevant personal protective equipment
Driver has required documentation for their load
Driver ensures that only authorised passengers ride in the vehicle and that seat belts are worn at required times
competencies.supportingText: 1. Why are unauthorised passengers not allowed to ride in the vehicle?

competencies.name: Driver ensures that employees do not ride on the back or any other part of the vehicle
competencies.supportingText: 1. Why is it important that employees do not ride on the back or any other part of the vehicle?

competencies.name: Driver ensures the safety self, the public and other road users when stopping, starting and positioning the vehicle

Driver operates vehicle safely:
  1. following public highway traffic convention
  2. with due consideration to others
Driver ensures that no loading takes place while the vehicle is in motion
Driver check that the vehicle is loaded safely with no over-loading or overhanging items
competencies.supportingText:
1. Why is it necessary to remove over-hanging items?
  2. Why is it necessary to check the vehicle is not over-loaded?

competencies.name: Reversing operations are conducted safely following company procedure (or as detailed in WAP9)
Driver measures the highest point of the vehicle using the height measuring device supplied
Driver accurately records the height of the vehicle on the vehicle height indicator which is clearly visible at all times  in the cab
Driver uses the vehicle height indicator to asses vehicle clearances under bridges
Driver ensures that, when operating on a site, the site is closed or the area cordoned off and all persons clear of the area before loading  or unloading containers
competencies.supportingText: 1. What are the procedures when operating on a civic amenity site for the loading and unloading of containers?

competencies.name: Driver complies with all site safety rules when on customer’s premises or tipping sites
competencies.supportingText:
1. What are the major safety rules that must be complied with on customer’s premises?
  2. What are the major safety rules that must be complied with on tipping sites?

competencies.name: Driver checks to ensure that it is safe to reverse onto the container or mobile compactor before moving the vehicle
Driver checks the condition of the container following company checklist before hoisting
Driver records any container defects in the Defects Book
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the company procedure for recoding container defects?

competencies.name: Driver checks that the container has a correctly fitted bale-bar deflector plate
Driver uplifts containers without bale-bar deflectors ensuring that the hook is correctly engaged
Driver defects container without bale-bar deflector once it has been emptied
Driver informs supervisor when third party containers do not have bale-bar deflector fitted
Driver ensures that  the hook is securely engaged with the bale‑bar and no other part of the container body before uplifting container
Driver ensures that no one is standing behind the container or is likely to do so
Driver avoids direct contact with the waste
Driver uses personal protective equipment provided including coveralls, safety footwear and eye protection (latter as required)
Driver checks that the container is secured and locked in position before driving off
Driver creates a safety zone using cones around containers which have not locked or do not sit on the vehicle body correctly
competencies.supportingText: 1. What are the company procedures for creating a safety zone around containers which have not locked or do not sit on the vehicle body correctly?

competencies.name: Safety zone is at least as wide as the vehicle/container is high
competencies.supportingText: 1. How do you decide how large a safety zone must be?

competencies.name: Driver ensures that the safety zone is monitored to prevent anyone entering the zone
competencies.supportingText: 1. Why is it important to monitor the safety zone on a regular basis?

competencies.name: Driver attempts to lower the container and reload it correctly
Driver contacts supervisor if container still fails to load correctly and request attendance of a fitter
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the company procedure notifying your supervisor if container fails to load correctly?

competencies.name: Driver checks final position before off-loading a container
Driver checks regularly to ensure load has not become unstable or dangerous during loading and travelling
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the company procedure if a load has become unstable or dangerous?

competencies.name: Driver stops vehicle if load has become unstable or dangerous and assesses if it is safe to readjust the load
Driver informs supervisor if it is unsafe to reload the vehicle and requests assistance from nearest fleet workshop
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the company procedure for informing your supervisor if it is unsafe to reload the vehicle?

competencies.name: Driver checks that there are no obstructions or trip hazards behind the vehicle before opening rear doors
Driver checks that there are no overhead obstructions before opening rear door
Driver stands to the side of the opening door, moving with the door as it opens
Driver secures the opened doors
Driver reports defective door mechanisms or fastenings to supervisor
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the company procedure for reporting defective door mechanisms or fastenings to supervisor?

competencies.name: Driver checks that there are no obstruction before off-loading a container
Driver ensures that the container is fully lowered and secure before driving off
Driver checks that the container has been correctly positioned before leaving the location

sections.name: C - Sheeting and Un-sheeting – Automatic Sheeting

competencies.name: Driver checks for any overhanging, loose or trailing contents or any material that could prevent the use of the auto-sheeting system
Driver trims the load from ground level to allow auto-sheeting
Driver uses secure lockable steps, an access platform or a fall-arrest system when trimming the load is not possible from ground level
competencies.supportingText: 1. Which types of equipment must be used if you cannot trim the load from ground level?

competencies.name: Driver ensures that correct protection procedures are followed when working from height
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the company procedure for protecting yourself when working from height?

competencies.name: Driver informs supervisor if unable to work safely from height
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the company procedure for informing supervisor if you are unable to work from height?

competencies.name: Driver ensures that assistance is available when using a fall-arrest system to prevent suspension trauma
competencies.supportingText: 1. Why is it important to ensure someone is with you when using a fall-arrest system?

competencies.name: Driver ensures safety harness is correctly adjusted before use
competencies.supportingText: 1. How do you adjust a safety harness before use?

competencies.name: Driver follows company procedure for the checking and storage of safety harnesses
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the company procedure for checking and storing safety harnesses?

competencies.name: Driver reports any problems with the condition and use of the safety harness to supervisor
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the company procedure for reporting any problems with the condition or use of the safety harness to your supervisor?

competencies.name: Driver ensures that the safety  harness is never used when alone
competencies.supportingText: 1. Why is it important never to use a safety harness if working alone?
